com.mapmyfitness.android.mmfremoteappexample.app.com.mapmyfitness.android.mmfremote
Interface RemoteCommandListener

public interface RemoteCommandListener

Listener used to register with RemoteManager to receive commands from the app. These commands will allow your UI to adjust depending on the state of the MMF app.

Method Summary

Method Detail

onAppStateEvent

void onAppStateEvent(AppState appState)
When your application connects to the MMF app, it will automatically receive a call to this event. Allowing you to immediately adjust your UI depending on the state of the MMF app.

Parameters:
appState - AppState the current state of the app

onAppConfiguredEvent

void onAppConfiguredEvent(java.lang.Boolean metric,
                          java.lang.Boolean hasHeartRate,
                          java.lang.Boolean calculatesCalories,
                          java.lang.Boolean isSpeed)
This command is sent by the MMF app whenever a configuation change happens. This includes: - the user changing the preferred units. They can select Metric or Imperial units. - the user connecting/disconnecting a heart rate device - the user setting a preference for the app to display speed or pace.

Parameters:
metric - Boolean if true, the user would like to see units in metric, otherwise in imperial units.
hasHeartRate - Boolean if true, the app will send heart rate information during the workout
calculatesCalories - Boolean if true, the app will calculate calories and send them to the app.
isSpeed - Boolean if true the user would like to see speed for all their workouts. DEFAULT is speed for biking and pace for everything else.

onStartWorkoutEvent

void onStartWorkoutEvent(java.lang.Boolean metric,
                         java.lang.Boolean hasHeartRate,
                         java.lang.Boolean calculatesCalories,
                         java.lang.Boolean isSpeed)
This command is sent by the MMF app whenever a workout has been started. It sends the same configuration information as the onAppConfiguredEvent(Boolean, Boolean, Boolean, Boolean)

Parameters:
metric - Boolean if true, the user would like to see units in metric, otherwise in imperial units.
hasHeartRate - Boolean if true, the app will send heart rate information during the workout
calculatesCalories - Boolean if true, the app will calculate calories and send them to the app.
isSpeed - Boolean if true the user would like to see speed for all their workouts. DEFAULT is speed for biking and pace for everything else.

onPauseWorkoutEvent

void onPauseWorkoutEvent()
The user has paused the workout. The app will not send any data while the workout is paused. Once a workout is paused the next event will either be onResumeWorkoutEvent() if the workout is to be resumed or onStopWorkoutEvent() if the workout is being stopped.

onResumeWorkoutEvent

void onResumeWorkoutEvent()
The user has resumed their workout. Data will resume from the app until the user pauses the app.

onStopWorkoutEvent

void onStopWorkoutEvent()
The user has stopped the workout. At this point the workout has not been saved. The user must take one of two actions: - Save the workout, which will produce the onSaveWorkoutEvent() event. - Discard the workout, which will produce the onDiscardWorkoutEvent() event. The app will now be in the AppState.POST_RECORDING state.

onSaveWorkoutEvent

void onSaveWorkoutEvent()
The workout has been saved and the app can now return to the AppState.NOT_RECORDING state.

onDiscardWorkoutEvent

void onDiscardWorkoutEvent()
The workout has been discarded and the app can now return to the AppState.NOT_RECORDING state.

onGpsStatusWarning

void onGpsStatusWarning(GpsStatus gpsStatus)
The current status of the GPS lock on the MMF app. If no GPS is available and the user tries to start a workout this event will be triggered. If GpsStatus.GPS_NOT_AVAILABLE then the user can wait for a GPS lock, at which point this event will be triggered with GpsStatus.GPS_AVAILABLE, or a workout may be started at any point without the GPS using RemoteManager.startWithoutGpsCommand(), or the workout may be cancelled using RemoteManager.cancelWorkoutStart()

Parameters:
gpsStatus - GpsStatus with the GPS status of the MMF app

onLocationServicesStatusEvent

void onLocationServicesStatusEvent()
If the MMF app is opened on the phone, and a user tries to start a workout, and the location services is turned on, a warning wil display on the app. At this point the user can start without GPS using RemoteManager.startWithoutGpsCommand() or cancel the start using RemoteManager.cancelWorkoutStart() ()}

onForceUpgrade

void onForceUpgrade(java.lang.Integer minSdkVersion)
The phone has requested that this SDK be upgraded above the minSdkVersion. If you continue to use an SDK version below this MMF will not be able to support it, nor can we guarantee the behavior.

Parameters:
minSdkVersion - the minimum SDK version that the connected app supports.
